Description: Sets the name of the module to load on start. Official modules are stored in 'data' and custom modules need to be stored in 'user'. Module name must match the file name exactly without the extension
Loads and runs the specified saved game slot number on server startup
Sets the minimum character level required to access the server
Sets the maximum character level allowed to access the server

DisplayName: Allow DMs to Log In as Players
Description: If set, DMs can log in as players
Sets the [NWSync URL](https://nwn.wiki/display/NWN1/NWSync) the server should advertise to clients
Sets the NWSync Manifest Hash the server should advertise. Will attempt to fetch /latest from the URL if not given
If set, the server will advertise the hak list despite a manifest being present. By default, a present NWSync manifest replaces the hak advertisement
Sets the [server release version](https://nwn.beamdog.net/downloads/) to install. Must be the one-, two-, or three-part version number, as applicable. Empty = latest

If set, AMP will not download the NWNEE client files from Steam when the server is updated. The relevant client data files will need to be installed manually in the 'data' directory in the instance's base directory in order for official modules to be used
Sets the server name as shown in the server browser
If set, the server will be listed in the public server browser
Set which game room to post the game to. This only applies if the server is public
Sets the maximum number of players that can connect to the server at one time
Sets the password required for players to join the server
Sets the password required to join the server as a DM
Sets the port the server listens on
If set, autosave is enabled. Should not be used with persistent worlds.
Sets the autosave interval in minutes.
If set, the module will be reloaded when the server is empty
Controls player versus player combat settings: No PvP, Party PvP (only within party), or Full PvP (all players).
If set, the server will be restricted to one party, and multiple parties will not be allowed
Determines how character files are stored: locally on clients or on the server. Server storage allows characters to be used on any client.
Organizes character save files by player name instead of character name, allowing multiple characters per player.
Prevents players from changing their names after creating a character, ensuring consistent identification.
Disables the default server-side character storage, forcing all characters to be stored locally on clients.
Creates backup copies of server-stored characters to prevent data loss.
Includes character data in save game files, allowing characters to be restored from saves.
Restricts character loading to those stored in the vault only, preventing local character imports.

DisplayName: Show DM Join Messages in chat
Description: If set, DM join messages are shown in chat

DisplayName: Show Player Join Messages in chat
Description: If set, player join messages are shown in chat
If set, the game can be paused by players. Otherwise, it can only be paused by a DM
Compresses the campaign database to save disk space and improve performance.
Sets the character encoding for game text, affecting how special characters and non-English text are displayed.
Forces the game to use a specific language for all text, overriding individual client language settings.
Sets the overall difficulty level for the game, affecting enemy strength, loot, and player progression.
Enforces D&D rules for character creation, preventing illegal ability scores, races, classes, and multiclass combinations.
Restricts items based on character level to maintain game balance and prevent powergaming.
Makes natural 1 rolls automatically fail saving throws, increasing challenge and emphasizing luck in critical moments.
Checks spell validity and prevents invalid spell usage, ensuring rule compliance.

DisplayName: Always Roll Max Hitpoints on Levelup
Description: Characters gain maximum hit points on level up instead of rolling dice, reducing randomness in character power.
Prevents displaying hit point gains in chat when leveling up, reducing spam in multiplayer games.
Displays active spell effects and buffs on characters, providing visual feedback for ongoing magical effects.
Displays challenge ratings for creatures and encounters, helping players gauge difficulty.
Limits the maximum bonus from ability scores in combat calculations to prevent overpowered characters.
Limits the maximum penalty from ability scores in combat calculations to prevent underpowered characters.
Caps the total attack bonus a character can have to balance high-level combat.
Caps the total damage bonus a character can have to prevent excessive damage output.
Caps the total saving throw bonus a character can have to balance defensive capabilities.
Caps the total skill bonus a character can have to prevent skill-based exploits.
Combat modes remain active until manually deactivated, rather than resetting after each action.
Forces all encounters to reset when the area is unloaded, even if not cleared, ensuring consistent replayability.
Sets the max concurrent HTTP connections
If set, HTTP disk cache is enabled
Sets the HTTP disk cache size
If set, HTTP disk cache compression is enabled
If set, SSL is required
Sets the SSL CA bundle
Sets the SSL CA path
Sets the UDP window timeout
Sets the master server authentication mode
If set, enforce authentication on private networks
Sets the 2DA engine cache size
Sets the 2DA user cache size
Sets the game object update interval
Sets the game object update interval during loading
Sets the game object cache size
Sets the message limit
Sets the message limit during loading

DisplayName: Clients Required to Disable CPU Sleep
Description: Sets the number of clients required to disable CPU sleep
Sets the max memory usage
Sets the threaded timers resolution
If set, use threaded timers
Sets the SQLite busy timeout
If set, enable SQLite profile trace
Sets the SQLite profile threshold
If set, enable SQLite statement trace
Sets the max mutex wait time
Sets the max threadpool size
If set, enable Tracy instrumentation
Sets the Tracy port
If set, enable NWScript debugger
Sets the debugger address
Sets the debugger port
If set, abort script without NWNX
If set, enable debug assert
If set, enable debug network
If set, enable debug NUI
If set, enable debug ScriptVM
If set, log creature deaths
If set, debug mode sends to players
If set, enable log rotation
